attributes.action: To legislate for new homes to have compulsory photovoltaic panel installation
attributes.background: To make sure new homes are built with photovoltaic panels able to cover to some degree the energy requirements of the household
attributes.additional_details: Because it’s the right action for the environment and because the UK needs to explore avenues of energy autonomy because of social and national security reasons

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/617573

attributes.action: Revert registering a death back to the coronavirus act 2020 (Priti Patel Mar 20)
attributes.background: We would like to streamline the process of registering a death utilising a more efficient, cost effective, modern approach as was implemented during the coronavirus pandemic.
attributes.additional_details:
Benefitting bereaved families to register a death remotely without a physical appointment.
Option for registrars to work from home should the need arise.
More efficient for the registrars and families to issue documents.
Reduces the impact on the environment. (Less Car Journeys)

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/608938

attributes.action: Allow schools to open all year round, for fewer days per week
attributes.background: The Government should help to provide children with stability by allowing schools to open for more than 38 weeks a year while reducing the number of days per week. This could allow children more time with family, help to safeguard them from negative environments, and reduce stress for parents.
attributes.additional_details:
This could also:
- Make it easier for parents to find reliable options of child care to allow them to work
- Give children year-round access to a stable environment where teachers can better safeguard them
- Give children things to do throughout the year, reducing risk of destructive behaviours and boredom
- Ease pressure on services by reducing the numbers of staff taking time off to care for their children at any one time

attributes.action: Keep Gyms Open Indefinitely In England No Matter What Restrictions Are In Place
attributes.background: Consider keeping gyms open no matter what restrictions are in place in order to help better the health and mental health of the nation, help lower suicide rates and hospital admissions of issues caused but obesity and inactivity.
attributes.additional_details: We the people of the nation for the most part that closing gyms a place of health and self improvement during a health crisis is ludicrous. The data shows transmission rates in gyms are low, gyms already have a test and trace system in place, covid has a worse effect on obese people, resistance training can’t be mimicked effectively outside of a gym and is important for preventing many health issues, gyms have immense mental health benefits the separation from the home environment is important.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/563904

attributes.action: Stop Low Traffic Neighbourhood (LTN) schemes in London
attributes.background: Councils in London have introduced LTN's i.e. the closure of many side streets, in a bid to encourage walking and cycling and to reduce traffic. These schemes are instead causing disruption to citizens' everyday lives. Fining people for driving in roads they've always driven in is unjust.
attributes.additional_details:
Many side streets in London have been closed off to cars, thus causing people to drive via the main road.
Main roads are therefore a lot more congested than in the past, thus causing more time spent in traffic jams. 
Rather than driving directly home, we now need to take a longer route, which is unfair and irritating.
Due to having to drive via the main road, rather than taking short cuts, journeys are a lot longer and thus has a negative impact on the environment and on mental health.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is the responsibility of your local council and Transport for London, not the UK Government or House of Commons.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

The London Assembly has its own petitions process. You can find out more about how to petition the London Assembly here: https://www.london.gov.uk/about-us/london-assembly/petitions

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Impose stricter requirements on reallocation of road space by local authorities: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/550887

attributes.action: Allow Indoor Play Centres to stay open in tier 3 Areas of Covid Lockdown
attributes.background:
Allow all indoor activity centres to stay open Toddlers and babies  need to learn social skills. Recently published theres has been huge findings on the forgotten early years child that they need interaction with others 
No justifiable reason has been given as to why they have to remain closed
attributes.additional_details:
With the new tier boundaries set out for the coming weeks. Indoor Activity Centres have been hit in tier 3 leaving pre school children to suffer! There are no proven cases that children have passed on the disease having been to a centre.  Families and business owners are going to suffer. These centres are also the back bone for Sen Children  as a safe environment for play and inter action 
Gyms Hairdressing Saloons Etc can open 
WE NEED YOUR SUPPORT FOR US TO STAY OPEN TO ALLOW KIDS TO PLAY.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/561997

attributes.action: After Brexit, ban the carriage of shark fins in & out of the UK for personal use
attributes.background:
EU law allows individuals travelling to Europe to carry 20kg of dried shark fins for personal consumption.

This creates demand for fins, damaging shark populations. 

After the end of the Brexit transition period, the UK government has the power to ban this open to exploitation practice.
attributes.additional_details:
More action is needed after the government response to this petition:

"The UK should ban the importation of Shark Fins"
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300535

To quote the Dept for Environment, Food & Rural Affairs:

"EU law allows individuals travelling to Europe to carry 20kg of dried shark fins for personal consumption. Our departure from the EU allows us to consider options to tighten the personal import allowance and improve the traceability of the shark in fin trade in the UK."

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/329978

attributes.action: Stop community NHS staff being taxed on millage claims
attributes.background: Ideally NHS staff should have NHS poole cars with an exemption for parking. That way NHS staff workers will not be losing pay whilst carrying out their role. Otherwise the staff should not be taxed for millage and parking expenses whilst out carrying their job role
attributes.additional_details: The NHS staff have continued their essential work throughout the pandemic, and community staff have been visiting women and families in their home environment as well as community clinic settings. They should not be penalised for their work with paying further tax.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. Millage claims are already tax free under HMRC rules. You can find out more here:

https://www.gov.uk/expenses-and-benefits-business-travel-mileage/rules-for-tax
	
You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Put David Attenborough's face on the twenty pound notes before he dies!
attributes.background: I think, after all David Attenborough's great achievements, he should witness the countries gratitude by seeing an image of his own lovely face on the twenty pound notes. Will settle for a ten pound note but not a fifty (as I very rarely see them).
attributes.additional_details: David Attenborough has dedicated his life to animals, the environment and the world and, as a result, he is a national treasure!

rejection.details:
Bank notes are the responsibility of the Bank of England, which is independent of the Government and Parliament.

You can find out how the Bank decides who will be on bank notes here:
https://www.bankofengland.co.uk/banknotes/banknote-characters

attributes.action: Ban single use plastic bags across the country, including smaller retailers.
attributes.background: To impose a ban across the next 12 months to ban single-use plastic bags. Thin gauge bags cause damage to the environment. The ban imposed in 2015 has caused a reduction, but the charge is not enough. Currently, smaller retailers do not charge.
attributes.additional_details: To support the English people to transition to reusing bags they must be banned. The millions raised from plastic bags sales shows that people are still accessing single use plastic bags in vast amounts. We must transition to NO single use bags in the country, and use the sales from 'bags for life' instead. The risk to the environment is too great, the impact of micro plastics entering the food chain is vast, and cannot be ignored.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/328310

attributes.action: Abolish the Hostile Environment immigration policy.
attributes.background: Stop profiteering from extortionate visa charges. Reform the immigration department so that It treats people with respect, as human beings rather than animals. Stop destroying lives by depriving suspected illegals of work, homes and health care. Let us stop being ashamed to be British.
attributes.additional_details: Because the way things are fills me and many others with shame and disgust.

rejection.details:
We're not sure exactly what changes you'd like to see happen to the Home Office and immigration policy, but we think these petitions are simiar: 

Reduce extortionate and unnecessary UK Visa and Health Surcharge fees.
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/321737

Allow asylum seekers to work if their applications remain undecided for 6 months
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/317772

attributes.action: Increase Personal Protective Equipment standards for those on the front line.
attributes.background: Please reassess the minimal standard of PPE for those, in particular the ambulance service, who are on the front line. We have less protection than those who are working in the sterile, controlled environment of the hospital. Surgical masks do not protect us, at best we need FFP3s and level D tyvek.
attributes.additional_details: As we are about to face the height of the pandemic in the UK us on the frontline are scared to work. Currently even if the patient is Covid19+ we only have a surgical mask -most are expired- a flimsy sleeveless apron & glasses. Without increased PPE its a lose-lose situation for everyone. We will inevitably contract the virus further passing it on to loved ones becoming yet another statistic. As a result we will not be able to work reducing staff on the front line treating & caring for patients.

rejection.details:
Guidance on Covid-19 and the use of personal protective equipment (PPE) is a matter for Public Health England, and not the Government or Parliament.

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

www.gov.uk/coronavirus
https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/

The Government has also created an online service to help you out what you can do if you’re struggling because of coronavirus: https://www.gov.uk/find-coronavirus-support

You can read NHS tips to help if you are worried about coronavirus here: https://www.nhs.uk/oneyou/every-mind-matters/coronavirus-covid-19-anxiety-tips

You can read impartial analysis of the Government response to coronavirus and policy developments here: https://commonslibrary.parliament.uk/coronavirus/

You may also be interested to know that because of the large number of petitions that have been started in relation to coronavirus, the Petitions Committee has been questioning the Government about its response to the coronavirus outbreak.
 
Find out more: https://committees.parliament.uk/work/192/the-governments-response-to-coronavirus/

attributes.action: Independent school fees to be reduced by at lest 50% whilst they are shut.
attributes.background: Virtual lessons aren’t a direct replacement for a school environment education. No lunch, break/lunchtimes, PE lessons, games, IT, food tech, environmental studies etc. Parents need to ‘fill in’ as a teacher. Independent schools shouldn't be able to charge more than 50% of their fees whilst shut.
attributes.additional_details: Support this crisis by giving independent schools a maximum amount they can charge whilst they are shut! (suggestion is 50% of their fees) And no increase in fees for the next academic year.

rejection.details: We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. Independent schools are not the responsibility of the UK Government or Parliament, and so decisions to reduce or refund fees would be a matter for individual schools.

attributes.action: Accelerate dental contract reform to save NHS dental services
attributes.background:
The dental contract is failing the public, patients, dental practices and dental teams. Too many patients are finding it almost impossible to access NHS dental care and practices are struggling to survive in a failed system.
Patients and practices need urgent positive change.
attributes.additional_details: Dental contract reform has been underway for 14 years. In March 21 a government statement signalling building back better committed to pursue rapid meaningful change and to develop a reformed NHS system that provides high quality care and an environment where professionals can work to their full potential. But progress has been painfully slow, patients are unable to find an NHS dentist and dental team members are leaving the NHS for ever. Change is needed to protect NHS dental services.

rejection.details:
We understand you're concerned about the provision of dental services, but it's not clear how you want such services to be reformed.

You might like to sign these petitions which call for related actions:

Increase NHS dental care funding to improve availability for child and adults: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/601744

Increase funding to ensure all adults in England have access to an NHS dentist: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/605814

attributes.action: dvla 2 recognise libre sensors as a way of checking your blood for Hgv licence
attributes.background: I would like the government to make the libre sensors a way you can show the dvla your bloods etc for medical aswell as the finger pricks as said finger pricking doesn’t work for all of us with the different environment type jobs with have which gives a risk to infections

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/595580

attributes.action: Save Wethersfield Airfield
attributes.background: The Government is reneging on commitments in the Environment Act to stop the decline of wildlife by proposing to develop two mega-prisons on the site of the old Wethersfield airfield, which has become an important space for nature near Braintree, Essex.
attributes.additional_details: Some 74 species of birds, many Red-listed, nest nearby and the area comprises 75,000 trees and shrubs. The site also includes ancient woodland, as well as Great Crested Newts and rare orchids. Red-listed birds on the site include European Turtle Dove, Northern Lapwing and Grey Partridge.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about the prospect of new prisons being built around RAF Wethersfield, but we're not sure if you want the Government to commit to not building these prisons here, or take some other action or actions regarding this site.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

attributes.action: Enforce food producers to add eco ratings and eco impact data on food packaging.
attributes.background: Enforce food producers to add eco ratings and ecological impact data to food packaging. In the same format as the current traffic light system for  nutritional facts, to enable people to make a more informed choice regarding the impact the food they eat has on the environment.
attributes.additional_details: The world is facing an uncertain future and projections for climate change give us an insight into what the world will look like for our children and our children's children. We need to make changes to the way we live and the food we eat to make more eco friendly choices.  Adding an eco traffic light system to packaging, in the same way we do for nutritional facts, to highlight the carbon footprint, will help the general public make an informed decision.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: 

Require companies to display environmental rating of the products on packaging:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/599438

attributes.action: Put extra safety measurements in night clubs to avoid drinks getting spiked.
attributes.background:
The Government should make it a legal requirement for club owners to have drink testers / drink testing wristbands behind the bar available for anyone to ask for it through out the night.
This should come with no charge and the tests should clearly show if a drink has been spiked or not.
attributes.additional_details:
Without the Government’s help clubs won’t become a safer environment. 
These tests come at a pricey cost so some kind of Government funding should be put behind this however, I believe the club owners should pay most amount of the testing kits price, if a nightclub runs out of stock on the testers or doesn’t provide them when it’s made a legal requirement they should be fined.
We are talking about keeping the public protected unfortunately, numbers to do with drink spiking show otherwise.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign these petitions:

'Require clubs and bars to offer lids with straws for drinks': https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/596308

'Require licensed venues to introduce anti-spiking policies, and fund training': https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/599289

'Fund free drink spiking test kits for all bars': https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/597143

attributes.action: Make it illegal to remove & keep any coarse fish from our rivers & lakes in UK
attributes.background: Thousands of course fish and being taken from rivers and lakes each year to be eaten at home or sold. This, along with the introduction of otters and the invasion of cormorants on inland waters is having a devastating effect on our coarse fish numbers.
attributes.additional_details: We need to make it illegal to take fish for our rivers and lakes and it is unsustainable and stocks are being dramatically reduced. This will only be effective if the Environment Agency and/or Police actively address this problem.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/578485

attributes.action: Legalize powered vehicles (electric scooters/bicycles)
attributes.background:
Update the law to include and allow access to powered vehicles (electric scooters, bicycles). 
Mandatory use of helmet and high visibility vest, legal max speed and insurance requirement, would provide a safe environment for citizens to commute with minimum impact on the environment and distancing.
attributes.additional_details:
Compared to a bicycle an electric scooter is: easier to maneuver, easier to get out, the riders center of gravity is safer, has front and back light, has a more predictable and very reasonable top speed. Still most cyclists are able to overtake a scooter. doesn't allow for tricks like wheelies, people store them inside (less bikes stolen).
Legalizing powered vehicles would help reduce the emission levels, traffic jams and would be another step into the future of transportation for the UK.

rejection.details:
Electric bicycles are already legal to use, but we have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Legalise and regulate the use of privately owned eScooters before Spring 2021: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/553756

attributes.action: Create a UK Wellbeing and Future Generations Act
attributes.background: The Government should enact legislation to create new requirements for Public Bodies and Private Companies to consider the following areas when making any decisions: The Environment, Wellbeing, Future Generations, Health, Communities, Sustainable Development.
attributes.additional_details: I am calling for the UK Government to develop new legislation to include a stand-alone set of laws that requires Public Bodies and Private Companies to consider the impact of their operations' footprint on the above areas to ensure a better environment for Future Generations' to come. The legislation should include penalties for failure to consider the areas above when decisions are made.

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Do Not Let Coronavirus Affect University Students Grades.
attributes.background: Figure out a fair and equitable way in which grades will be marked considering the effect Coronavirus has to lecture delivery, living arrangements, wages, practicals/placements, study environment, stress levels, and many more factors. Detrimental policies do not support an improving student.
attributes.additional_details: University students are at a huge disadvantage, missing out on many opportunities which can assist their degree such as practicals and placements. Students have been forced to work from home, missing out on essential face-to-face teaching. Working from home instead of a University or Library setting has damaging effects to the quality of work produced, motivation, lack of resources and stress. Online learning has affected 2 academic years of teaching - which is a significant amount of time.

rejection.details:
Decisions about the assessment of university courses are a matter for individual universities, not the UK Government or Parliament.

The Office for Students has published guidance for providers about quality and standards during the coronavirus (COVID-19) pandemic, which sets out its expectations regarding teaching and assessments: https://www.officeforstudents.org.uk/publications/guidance-for-providers-about-quality-and-standards-during-coronavirus-pandemic/.

If you have concerns about your university's arrangements for teaching and assessment you should raise these with your university or the Office for Students, which regulates the higher education sector.

attributes.action: Ban single-use plastic bottles of water
attributes.background: Ban all plastic bottled water. We can easily use tap water and save the environment. If needed, we could add water dispensers in shops so you can fill up your own bottle. Some towns and cities have already banned plastic water bottles so it is not that difficult!
attributes.additional_details: It will help climate change because the factories that make the bottles  will not be producing as much carbon dioxide and it will help plastic pollution a lot because there will not be as many plastic bottles in the seas and in our environment.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/552450.

attributes.action: Cancel GCSE and A-level exams in England.
attributes.background: We wish for the government to cancel exams for GCSE and A-level students. Due to the inability to cover the full school syllabus. It is unfair to expect students to perform as successfully due to the current climate of COVID-19
attributes.additional_details: Students have been significantly impacted due to COVID-19. Students have had a reduced teacher student time and due to this outcome it has consequently effected students learning and ability to gain a high success in their final exams. It would be injustice to enforce an exam when students have been highly impacted due to the current climate. Cancelling the exam would allow students to have work examined that’s been learnt and taken place in a school environment.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/326066

attributes.action: Keep gyms and pools open as essential during national and local lockdowns
attributes.background: Keep gyms & pools open as essential throughout all lockdowns. They are highly important for physical and mental health and well being. Exercise boosts physical  immunity. Evidence shows gyms are low risk environments for covid spread. Benefits far outweigh risks of keeping gyms open. Keep them open.
attributes.additional_details: Gyms and pools are important for mental and health reasons. Gyms and low risk covid environments. Exercise helps build physical and mental strength to combat disease. Exercising alone or at home is not sufficient. Most people do not have the equipment at home to exercise properly plus the mental benefits of attending a facility to exercise and interact safely with others is never more important than now. Gyms and pools should be kept open to boost national morale and help fight covid spread.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Keep gyms and leisure facilities open during any lockdown: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/556956

Prevent gyms closing due to a spike in Covid 19 cases: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/333869

The Committee will be holding a debate on Covid-19 restrictions on gyms and sport on Monday 23 November. You will be able to watch the debate on Parliament TV at 4.30pm: https://www.parliamentlive.tv/Commons

attributes.action: Mandatory viewing of David Attenborough's A Life On Our Planet for all MPs in UK
attributes.background: We demand that everyone in governmental power, from all parties, watches this documentary and acts proactively towards Climate Change. We need to create systemic changes to our world, on a practical long lasting level.
attributes.additional_details: Because our future is at risk, this is an urgent issue. We want the government to care more about the environment and it's people. We want them to take action and make incentives like countries such as Costa Rica... We want them to educate themselves and care about the world we live in and the people they are creating laws for. We want them to use their power on a larger scale because we can't.

rejection.details:
The Government is not responsible for the viewing activity of individual MPs. This is a matter for each MP to decide for themselves.

We have published the following related petition, which you might like to sign:

Reform food, energy, environmental and fishing policy to save the planet: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/554376

attributes.action: Cancel 2021 exams for A level and GCSE students due to COVID-19 disruptions.
attributes.background: Due to the current situation regarding COVID-19, I believe that students are at a disadvantage from each other and previous years that have already completed year-end exams. Therefore I would like to suggest that students are centre assessed like the previous year.
attributes.additional_details: There are repeated and unpredictable disruptions to educational learning due to COVID-19 and self or household isolation. Remote learning does not provide an effective learning environment with some students requiring more support than online lessons and having limited IT facilities at home. Students, who are completing exams this year, are at a significant disadvantage to previous years and it is only fair that formal examinations should be cancelled.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/326066

attributes.action: 292 buses to turn their engines off while stationary at rossington ave, bwood
attributes.background: Rossington ave /Wetherby road residents need some help with fumes and noise coming off the busses, leaving  their engines running while stationary. Causing more pollution , this is no good for our environment  and health
attributes.additional_details: TFL who rent the bus route to metroline are doing absolutely nothing about these issues, WE NEED CHANGE AND CLEAN HEALTH

rejection.details: We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is a matter for TfL and the Mayor of London.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to release Chinese or flying lanterns
attributes.background: The government works hard to provide a thriving farming economy which this country should be proud of whilst it also has a booming equine industry. Chinese or flying lanterns cause pain, suffering and death for many of these harmless animals. To see them banned would put a stop to this.
attributes.additional_details:
The RSPCA reported “
An estimated 200,000 sky lanterns are sold and released each year in the UK. As the popularity of these items increase, so does the risk to wildlife. They also cause injury and suffering to animals and have a devastating impact on the environment.
There have been reports of animals becoming entangled in these lanterns and becoming injured trying to free themselves, which will cause extreme stress and suffering.” This is before discussing Ingestion  off them and wild fires.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/310556

attributes.action: Close UK airports for two months every year
attributes.background: In the light of the clear benefits to the environment revealed by the current coronavirus lockdown to prohibit air travel to and from the UK for two months every year.
attributes.additional_details: To give nature a break from human activity which is damaging to the environment; to acknowledge the negative impact air travel has on the environment; to encourage other ways of global contact; to begin promoting clean air; to recognise that humans are part of nature and not separate from it; to create a cleaner place for all species to co-exist; to recognise the damage already inflicted upon the earth by human activity and to set an example to encourage ongoing support for environmental change.

attributes.action: COVID-19 and Royal Mail works. STOP all advertising. Post essential mail ONLY
attributes.background: Instruction to the Post Office Group’s Chief Executive Nick Read to minimize work for all members of staff, from sorting offices and post workers by ONLY posting mail addresses to homeowners and NO door to door advertising during the COVID-19 virus time.
attributes.additional_details: This excess mail does not only make more staff spending unnecessary time mixing with other workers during the sorting process but also gives the post walkers more exposure time to environment rather than being at home in isolation. The 2 person to a delivery van has been affected and now more post is given to the post walker to deliver before returning to the vehicle meaning the load is greater and the distance is longer. Please reduce the risk to our Post Office team and STOP unnecessary mail.

rejection.details:
This would be a matter for Royal Mail.

You might like to sign this petition instead:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/308690

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for vulnerable, high risk workers to be sent home
attributes.background: Some employers have sent their high risk vulnerable workers home, other multi million pound companies are refusing to send their employees home without the government making it mandatory that these high risk groups need to self isolate.
attributes.additional_details: The option is to be off work unpaid, people cannot afford to take the time off work. Until this is enforced employers are having high risk people working in customer facing environments, which is not only life threatening but going against social distancing policies and not keeping people safe at work.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/305270

www.gov.uk/coronavirus

Read letters asking further questions of Government Ministers: https://committees.parliament.uk/committee/326/petitions-committee/publications/3/correspondence/

attributes.action: Cancel Placement for Nursing Students for 2 months
attributes.background: Nursing students are worried about going to placement, as this will put us at a higher risk of spreading COVID-19. Many of us will have a family to go home to, which can affect them. Medical students get their placements cancelled while nursing students don’t, and we interact with patients more.
attributes.additional_details: In the NMC Code, it states to “take account of your own personal safety”. Going on placement during this period of time will make us worry about our safety and how we are risking our own health when we’re only students, and we don’t get paid. On behalf of the nursing students studying at King’s College London, we would like the government to cancel our placement for the next 2 months until the infection has calmed down so that we have a safer environment to work in where we can actively learn.

rejection.details:
This is an operational decision for the NHS. 

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:

NHS website: https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/ 

UK Government website: https://www.gov.uk/guidance/coronavirus-covid-19-information-for-the-public

attributes.action: Ban unsolicited junk mail
attributes.background: Ban the distribution of unsolicited junk mail which not only is a nuisance but a detrimental affect on the environment and waste of energy and resources, contributing to landfill. Also current systems in place for refusing this service are not fit for purpose, complicated and timely.
attributes.additional_details: Ban the unsolicited distribution of junk mail and unaddressed items to residential and commercial properties

departments.name: Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

attributes.action: Ban ballon release
attributes.background: Ban the release of ballon’s in groups
attributes.additional_details: This is detrimental to the environment and kills wildlife

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition which calls for a similar action:

Make releasing helium balloons and sky lanterns a specific littering offence: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/609032

attributes.action: Provide homeless youth with 10 shelters in and around Birmingham.
attributes.background: We seek support from the Government to build and fund a minimum of 10 homeless centres across Birmingham, aimed, specifically, at vulnerable homeless youth. These centres should supply young people with a safe environment and basic necessities, including free sanitary products for women.
attributes.additional_details:
Statistics from Centrepoint estimate that nearly 122,000 young people across the UK were homeless or in danger of losing a home in 2020/21. As a large city, Birmingham reflects a high percentage of these figures.The pandemic, combined with the increase in the cost of living has exacerbated social and economic causes, particularly, for young people. 
We must provide targeted support to help break the cycle of homlessness and the provision of more secure accomodation is essential to achieving this.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about local accommodation for homeless people are a matter for individual local authorities, not the UK Government or Parliament.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them, by entering your post code here:
https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Increase funding to house and support the homeless: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/614065

Help the homeless by funding a shelter and at least one healthy meal per day: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/611379

attributes.action: Ban the sale of single-use disposable vapes in the UK.
attributes.background: 90% of disposable vapes are made in China. A disposable vape ranges anywhere between £3-£10 and tends to last up to only a few days; They're almost all made up of plastic outer casings and contain non-recyclable batteries. They end up on our streets or in landfill sites; please ban the sale of them.
attributes.additional_details: While our climate crisis is becoming exponentially worrying, the issue has to be at the forefront of our attention. While the transportation of vapes from China to the UK contributes to our global climate, the levels of ill-disposed vapes within the UK are also a huge problem. The process of recycling plastic is costly and detrimental to the environment in itself; however, they nearly all end up on the streets or in mixed waste bins and therefore contribute to the existing landfill crisis.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/612333

attributes.action: End Houses of Parliament bars alcohol subsidy and ban consumption of alcohol
attributes.background:
End the taxpayer subsidy for alcohol in the Houses of Parliament bars.

Ban consumption of alcohol on all government property.
attributes.additional_details:
Many employers have a complete ban on drinking in the work place and during work hours.

Yet the tax payer subsidises the consumption of alcohol in the Houses of Parliament.

This subsidy should end.

The consumption of alcohol on all government property should be banned.

It is 2022 and time to bring the working environment of MPs and staff in line with the rest of society.

I quote the Sue Grey report:

"iv. The excessive consumption of alcohol is not appropriate in a professional workplace at any time. Steps must be taken to ensure that every Government Department has a clear and robust policy in place covering the consumption of alcohol in the workplace."

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition calling for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/604101

The House of Commons Catering service does not provide a subsidised service in the commercial sense of the word. Some venues make a profit, while in other venues the cost of providing the service does exceed the income received in sales due to the irregular hours and unpredictability of parliamentary business. The House of Commons publishes details of the cost of House of Commons catering services: https://www.parliament.uk/site-information/foi/transparency-publications/hoc-transparency-publications/catering-services/transparency-reporting-catering-services/

attributes.action: A Referendum on the Green Revolution
attributes.background:
I want parliamentary debates on the best way to achieve our Green goals.
I want transparency and most of all I want the people to choose for themselves. For the people by the people
attributes.additional_details: Set up debates on Green energy, on electrification, on nature reserves and on Green jobs to look after our environment.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We understand that you are concerned about public input to proposals to achieve environmental goals, but we're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

We have published the following petition, which you might like to sign:

Hold a referendum on whether to keep the 2050 net zero target: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/599602

attributes.action: Make vaccination freely available at airports to UK arrivals
attributes.background: To support and protect incoming travellers for a healthy environment all over the world.
attributes.additional_details: Only the Government has the power to take this step to help better protect incoming travellers and the world. Moreover, if this change takes place in the UK, it could encourage other nations to take such valuable steps afterwards.

departments.name: Department of Health and Social Care

attributes.action: Make the car tax (VED) system fairer
attributes.background: Scrap the current VED for a system based on mileage.
attributes.additional_details:
The current system is extremely unfair for low mileage users who have to pay the same tax on their vehicle, make those that use the roads pay for what mileage they do.
Low mileage users do not cause as much damage to the environment or climate issues, those that cause or contribute the most should pay.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/584712

attributes.action: Fit all new build houses with renewable energy devices.
attributes.background: To make all new build homes suitable for a more eco freindly future, this would require all new buildings to fit or attach a minimum of 4 solar panels or a renewable energy device with an equivalent power output.
attributes.additional_details: With the environment suffering with emission control, and the all countries focusing on vehicle production becoming  all electric by 2030 it seems vital that every household should be concentrating on producing electricity to help power stations  from burning excessive fossil fuels. This seems like a great opportunity to start building a more environmentally friendly britain and start a trend all coutries should embrace.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition calling for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/573013

attributes.action: Change the school exam grading system to year round progressive assessment
attributes.background: I would like the school exam assessment regime changed to a mix of teacher assessed, class work and test awarded grades.
attributes.additional_details: This would ease the pressure and stress of students making their overall mental health better, in addition students would have a more balanced workload allowing them to exercise, socialise and pick up hobbies and volunteering roles improving their physical health and contribution to society. It is more realistic, and more aligned to the workplace environment and demonstrates more of what students can achieve. It is also a more progressive learning style that can be adaptable to individual needs.

attributes.action: Offer an additional year of SFE funding for students impacted by the pandemic
attributes.background: The effects of the Covid-19 pandemic on students' mental wellbeing and ability to study have been varied and significant. While many have benefited from the supports offered by universities, many others - particularly those facing additional pressures have seen negative impacts on their grades.
attributes.additional_details: Students are currently facing the challenge of studying from home for their degree while missing out on valuable - and at times essential - practical experience, dealing with additional caring responsibilities, parenting and home schooling, struggling with disabilities and learning difficulties, difficult home working environments. Many such students are seeing home learning negatively impact their grades but cannot in the current system get funding to take a resit year or leave of absence.

attributes.action: Revoke the neonicotinoid insecticide authorisation and ban its future use
attributes.background: This authorisation is a knee-jerk reaction that doesn't see the bigger picture and might cause immense harm. Almost three quarters or our crops are pollinated by bees yet we have possibly lost a third of our bees in the last ten years. Neonicotinoids ultimately kill off bees and other pollinators.
attributes.additional_details:
The Govt is going back on its word on "maintaining environmental standards and international obligations from 1 January 2021." They claimed its 25 Year Environment Plan would see "the first generation to leave the natural environment in a better state than it inherited it." 
Save our future. Stick to your word.

rejection.details:
You might like to sign the following petitions:

Overturn the decision to allow the use of neonicotinoid pesticides
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/569214

Continue the ban on the use of Neonicotinoids
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/563943

attributes.action: Allow care agency workers to receive the £500 bonus payment in Scotland
attributes.background: Currently all health and social care staff including NHS, students and support workers are eligible for the £500 bonus payment. However, this does not extend to agency workers despite many of them working long hours in high risk environments to cover staff shortages and help keep care homes afloat.
attributes.additional_details: Social care workers are expected to support people who may need assistance of varying degrees with activities of daily living. They are not nurses and aren’t specifically trained to look after acutely unwell residents. With outbreaks of Covid-19 in care and residential homes, all staff were expected to adjust their role accordingly. Contracted staff are being thanked for this however agency workers, many of whom worked alongside doing the exact same job, are not eligible.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. 

Your petition is about something that the Scottish Government is responsible for. That means that the UK Government and Parliament can't look into it.

The Scottish Parliament has its own Public Petitions Committee. If you'd like to send your petition to the Scottish Parliament, you can find out more here:
http://www.scottish.parliament.uk/gettinginvolved/petitions/index.aspx

attributes.action: Keep Childrens' Swimming Lessons operating through the next lockdown
attributes.background: With the next lockdown looming we would like to continue to operate our swimming lessons as this is an educational environment and promotes physical and mental well being through the dark winter months.
attributes.additional_details: This is because Government may impose the lockdown, therefore they are the only ones with the power to allow such support.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action. We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do.

Since you started your petition, the national lockdown has ended. Under the local restriction tiers introduced from 2 December, swimming pools can remain open in all tiers, but you could start a new petition calling for changes to the current tiered restrictions, if that's what you'd like to see happen.

attributes.action: Make work from home a worker's right.
attributes.background: During the Covid-19 pandemic, offices were closed, workers in mass were sent to work from home. This had shown great benefits for workers, businesses and the environment. With modern technology, many workers can work from home and do their job. Work from home should become a modern worker's right.
attributes.additional_details:
Working from home has be found to add great benefit to society at large. More time spent with family and friends due to no longer needing to commute, resulted in greater mental well-being. This is turn reduced stress levels and better child welfare. This is a key step to improving  societal health, and lowering the burden on the NHS.

Emissions have been reduced as less people cram into cars for a daily commute. With the advent of global warming, this helps the U' become carbon neutral.

rejection.details: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/318057

attributes.action: A mandatory prison sentence for those who assault emergency service personnel
attributes.background: We want a mandatory custodial prison sentence for anyone who assaults emergency service personnel
attributes.additional_details: Emergency service personnel deserve to work in a risk free environment without the fear of been assaulted, Police, Fire, Ambulance and other emergency workers should not be subjected to attacks and the government need to step up to protect them by making it a mandatory prison sentence for those who assault police fire and ambulance staff

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition calling for the same action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/309432

The Governmetn has also launched a consultation on doubling the maximum penalty for assaults or attacks on emergency workers, which you might like to contribute to:  https://www.gov.uk/government/news/consultation-launched-on-doubling-maximum-sentence-for-assaulting-an-emergency-worker

attributes.action: Remove the government mandating of wearing facemasks in Shops and public places.
attributes.background: Wearing a facemask should be optional NOT mandated!  This is taking away freedoms and rights of the general public and is not based on evidence from a reliable source.  Masks do little to stop transmition and in fact can make you ill. Healthy people should not be forced to wear one!
attributes.additional_details: There is much information showing that wearing a face mask to protect against Covid 19 specifically, has little, if any value and can in fact be harmful.  Masks designed for use in contaminated environments expels toxins without filtering. Surgical ones are for sterile environments having little effect outside of this and are potentially virus spreaders when used incorrectly. A home made one has no protection at all. Breathing your own toxins is bad for you. We MUST have the right to choose.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Don't make the wearing of face masks compulsory in public places in England: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/331174

Repeal the decision to implement compulsory face coverings in English shops: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/331430

Make the use of masks on public transport voluntary and not mandatory: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/325079
